article_title: How to save Alaska's failing health insurance market
article_text: The healthy people who make up the majority of the customer base have seen enormous rate hikes and are more likely to see injustice in this system than seriously ill customers who are far more worried about when or if they will ever be healthy again. While many customers qualify for federal subsidies, those who have decent jobs are paying amounts that rival home mortgages.

article_metadata.description: Extreme medical bills from about 4 percent of the customers in the individual market and tens of millions in losses by the insurance companies have led to a crisis in Alaska.

og.description: Extreme medical bills from about 4 percent of the customers in the individual market and tens of millions in losses by the insurance companies have led to a crisis in Alaska.
og.title: How to save Alaska's failing health insurance market

article_summary:
While many customers qualify for federal subsidies, those who have decent jobs are paying amounts that rival home mortgages.
The healthy people who make up the majority of the customer base have seen enormous rate hikes and are more likely to see injustice in this system than seriously ill customers who are far more worried about when or if they will ever be healthy again.
